FCC LFGAL STAFF APPOtNTMFNTS
The Federal Communications Commission recently announced the appointment
OF Lester W„ Spillane as Assistant General Counsel in charge of Safety and
Special Services, and of Vi/ALTER £<> James to be Assistant to the General
Counsel, They succeed, respectively, Jeremiah Courtney and Norman Eo
Jergensen who resigned to enter private law practice.
Educated n the public schools of Milwauk&e, Oregon, the University of Ore
G( N AND Northwestern College of Law of Portland, Mr, Spillane began his
Government career in 1920 with the Radio Division of the Department of
Commerce, countinuing with the Federal Radio Commission and its succESSORjCh
the Communications Commission^ For JO years he worked in radio
inspection offices at Seattle and Portland.
Mr, James was born at Montgomery, Alabama, amd received his LL,B at (5e0R'3e
Washington UniversitYo He «s a mamber of the Alabama and District of Columpi
Bar*. First employed as assistant to Commissioner Clifford J^ Durr, he late

early 5944 WHEN HE ENTERED THE NaWo AS A LIEUTENANT, HE SAW ACTION AT
iwo JiMA, Okinawa and with the Third Fleet in the Fast China Sea„ Revurninc
